WorkItem.Description: When I try to run ModernUIDemo.exe on a machine (Win Server 2008 R2) with .NET 3.5 only the app crashes without prompting to download the required framework. What can I do?

Comments.Message: The framework is designed to work with .net 4.0 and above, i think.But ModernUIDemo.exe sure is. Just install .net 4.0 and the exe will run.
I use some .NET 4.5 features like async/await but my app crashes with the "close or debug" prompt only. The app ignores the -section in the configuration. Any idea why?
BladeFire is correct; MUI requires .NET 4 or higher

What can I do to see the default messagebox like here:[http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9132848/why-does-my-app-require-the-full-net-4-framework](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9132848/why-does-my-app-require-the-full-net-4-framework)

I know, MUI requires 4.0 but users don't know.

Open you project and go to Project>[Project Name] Properties option in the menu, and change the Target Framework property to whatever you want.

This will solve all you  problems.Hope this helps.
